_header: Alas good man must you be kissed
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 97.
_description: Come Kiss Me — eleven quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘…ye shall not kiss me’ and three-line burden: ‘I pray yow cum kyss me / My lytle prety mopse / I pray yow com kyss me’

CantLetters173.First Lines:
I pray yow come kyss meMy lytle prety mopseI pray yow com kyss
                    meAlas good man most yow be kystYe shall not now ye may me
                    trustWherefore go where as ye best lustffor I wyss ye shall not kyss
                    me…
CantLetters173.Last Lines:
…And euer yore ow[ne] ye shall me fyndAt all tymys redy to
                    kyss yow
